instructions: In the iTunes Store, tap More, then tap Purchased. If you set up Family Sharing, choose a family member to view their purchases. Note: You can see purchases made by family members only if they choose to share their purchases. Tap Music, Movies, or TV Shows. Find the item you want to download, then tap the Download button .

Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 1 1 Open Settings Image titled Android7settingsapp.png . To do this, swipe down from the top of the home screen and tap the gear at the top-right corner. [1] If you've already added your fingerprint, see Turning on Fingerprint Security on Venmo . Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 2 2 Tap or . The name of this menu (and other menus in Settings) varies by Android, but you'll usually find your fingerprint settings in a menu that contains the word "Security." Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 3 3 Tap or . If you don't see one of these options (or something similar), you may have to tap an option called . [2] Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 4 4 Follow the on-screen instructions to add your fingerprint. The steps will vary depending on your Android. You'll usually have to place your finger on the fingerprint sensor and move it around as described on your screen. Advertisement

Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 5 1 Open Venmo. This app icon looks like a white V on a blue background. You can find it on your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 6 2 Tap . This is in the upper left of your screen. Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 7 3 Tap . This is at the bottom of the menu. Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 8 4 Scroll down and tap . This is under the Security heading. Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 9 5 Slide the "PIN Settings" switch to the Image titled Android7switchon.png position. A screen with your number keyboard will appear. Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 10 6 Enter and confirm a 4-digit PIN. You'll have to enter it twice to ensure you've typed it correctly. Image titled Turn on Fingerprint Security on Venmo on Android Step 11 7 Slide the "Use Fingerprint" switch to the Image titled Android7switchon.png position. This ensures that you'll be asked to verify your fingerprint any time you open Venmo. [3] If your fingerprint isn't accepted, you'll always be prompted to enter your PIN. Advertisement
